website_summaries.verdict: A climber that is versatile enough to use outside in the summer and inside in the winter.
pros: You do not have to worry about rust
Made for younger climbers ages 3 to 6
Small enough you could put it indoors
cons: This is small and really only good for smaller kids

customer_reviews.title: Dual purpose
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!!! We used in the pool to help the kids gain some more confidence without just hanging out on the ladder and it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie Jansen

customer_reviews.title: We love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been a great purchase. It helps the kids burn energy throughout the day. My daughter plays with it almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: W.C. Olmsted

customer_reviews.title: ) a lot of time was wasted.
customer_reviews.text: I am not rating the toy, but the manufacture. The kids never used the toy because J5 is missing two black pens a serious safety hazard. The manufacture needs to make sure all parts are included before sealing the box. We spent 1 hour and 45 minutes putting some of this toy together. When we realized J5 was missing pieces. It was hard enough trying to connect these tubes now we have to 1.) undo our hard work 2.) repackage it. 3.) drop it off to return 4.) probably have to additional postage fee for returning 5.) a lot of time was wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Aubry Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and need a better solution than what is offered!
customer_reviews.text: The product is missing the piece that snaps into place on the J5 part. By the time this was realized, the structure was 3/4 the way built. I have put 2 hours into building it so far and my fingers are raw from snapping each part into place. The only replacement option is to take it completely apart and get an entirely new product shipped. That is absolutely ridiculous! The J5 part should be an easy part to replace on its own.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: also the plastic beams are not that sturdy, they were looking bendy when my 5 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Though the product idea is cute, it came with one b rod missing. We had assembled the whole thing by that point and the only option is sending it back which will eat up another 3 hours... also the plastic beams are not that sturdy, they were looking bendy when my 5 year old 45 pound kid climbed on
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: Being organized makes assembly a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it - definitely only good for kids that weigh under 50 lbs and no more than 3 kids at a time. There is plenty of flex, but not to the point of coming apart. It is cumbersome to put together, my advice is to separate all the parts by type - i.e. all the "A" in one bucket, "C" in another etc. I got my 4 year old involved in the assembly by telling him to bring me an "A", etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dham

customer_reviews.title: A dad’s worst nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: At first this seemed easy to put together but then it becomes impossible. The pieces are spring loaded and some of them just have no “give” to them so you can click the pieces together. And then when the spring pops out from trying to jam them together, you are totally out of luck because getting the spring back in is IMPOSSIBLE. So I have a half built toy in my backyard. Even if I could finish, the toy DOES NOT COME WITH ANCHORS which it says are mandatory. That gives this climbing tower an automatic F! Now I have no idea how to disassemble this...
customer_reviews.author: DLosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Missing the very last piece after it was put together!
customer_reviews.text: To say I am disappointed in this item is an understatement. I watched my husband sit for hours putting this together only to get to the very last part and be missing the last skinny black/dark connector piece that fits in the middle of the big blue soccer ball like pieces that connect to the green tubes. Are you kidding me? My boys turn two tomorrow, and we were beyond excited to give this to them. SO DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with wine. Must purchase separately.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. My son loves it. He’s three years old. I used a tide stick to push the locking balls down. Then I could easily slide the pipes into place. My delicate girl fingers needed extra leverage. Took about 45 -60 mins to assemble and three glasses of wine. Took me longer to figure out how to make a big bow, from ribbon I purchased in 1905 during a sale at Michael’s.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: and our kids loved it, so we decided get rid of some ...
customer_reviews.text: My friend had bought it for her sons, and our kids loved it, so we decided get rid of some small toys and buy one of these. I thought it would be good for the kids something at home when the weather isn’t good for playing outside. We love it, and the kids love it, and the kids’ friends love it. We sometimes put bed sheet over it to make it an igloo, too. I also love seeing my four year old climbing it while watching TV—it keeps him active.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Lee

customer_reviews.title: A huge hit!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our kids, and they love it! They are 4yrs and 3yrs old, and they both play on it and its withstands. It was fairly easy to put together minus having to put in every individual clip into the connectors. That was time consuming, but the assembly was simple and straightforward. There were two of us, and with a few mistakes, took us about an hour and a half. Ours is outside with no stakes placed, and we have had no issues with it moving or anything. They play on it everyday!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monique L.

customer_reviews.title: We use it in the house
customer_reviews.text: We have had this in our house for 2 years and the kids climb on it almost every day. We bought it for a 1 and 3 year old and we cut foam to fit the inside. At first we added pillows also in case of falls. This has been a well made product. Mom and grandma put it together in a couple hours. It helps with strength and coordination and we have had no injuries from falls. At some point we might move it outside but they use it all year round inside. The kids put blankets on for a fort. Good durable toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Andrews

customer_reviews.title: It’s light AND sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy structure. I’m covering it with a tarp and using it for a shelter for chickens. Putting it together was a real pain. It seems like a tool could be easily manufactured to make it easy to press in the buttons. Some buttons were much stiffer than others. The instructions weren’t exactly clear either. I don’t consider either of those things to be dealbreakers. It took about an hour for two people to assemble it. A couple tubes got connected to the wrong receiver and taking those apart was dreadful. Disassembling the whole unit would be a horrible experience I’m sure. All in all I really like this structure and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: The site says this is for ages 3-8. But the box says it's for ages 3-6. All the connectors are made with cheap plastic. The unit requires you to take it apart, or bring in doors during cold seasons, and to tighten the joints twice a month. Maintenance for this is untenable, considering how many better options are out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the rage.
customer_reviews.text: I am typically a patient person, and up for the challenge of some assembly required. But today I found my limit. If you want serious thumb pain, a wildly ineffective disassembly tool and modestly helpful instructions, this checks off all the boxes. I errantly connected some A tubes to a J5 arm joiner (instead of a J6) and after trying unsuccessfully with the disassembly tool to remove them I want very much to just smash everything. No luck with my incredibly sore thumbs or needle nose players either. If I ever get it set up it’s definitely not coming down unless I’m Happily smashing it to bits with a sledgehammmer!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Grzymkowski

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but isnt easy to move around to different rooms / switch indoor/ outdoor.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Only complaint I would have is it isnt easy to disassemble it once you assemble it. Those plastic tubes are impossible to pull out even with the small grip tool they have provided. So think twice before where you assemble this. New update : it’s damm impossible to change or swap places .. and the rods start to bend and useless
customer_reviews.author: YE Siva

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Hard to assemble but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not going to lie, this was the worst thing I’ve ever put together. Hated every second and my fingers hurt so bad. And you cannot mess up bc it is almost impossible to get apart. But still giving 5 stars because it’s sturdy and there is probably no other way they could have made this so sturdy without screws etc. and my 2.5 year old loves it. Our 4 yr old friends is obsessed too. Great purchase. If you are a frail lady then don’t attempt to put this together though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: First, note the size. This is for younger children and is not a huge unit. The assembly process is complicated because the instructions could be clearer, and the process of assembly is not intuitive. We had to backtrack several times when we presumed incorrect next steps. Also not that it is possible but very difficult to disassemble. The tubes are held in place by internal springer metal buttons that are very difficult to depress. Although it took a little longer to assemble than anticipated, it went together well at the end of the day and created exactly the device advertised.
customer_reviews.author: RP Sea

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Wait for the cheapest price.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves it! He did fall the first try, so adult supervision is definitely necessary. It is easy to assemble and take apart with the tool provided. Unfortunately I found the tool when I almost finished. It does shake a little, but it can handle my weight with no problem. I’m 120lb. It does not come with an anchor, so avoid strong sided movement otherwise you will need anchors. Overall my boys love it. And love to climb up and down for a long while everyday. The price changes frequently. It’s been changing from 138 to 199 on daily basis, maybe a little bit of consistency?
customer_reviews.author: Angela L.

customer_reviews.title: very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: very difficult to assembly ! there are these push pins that you very stiff and you need a screw driver or something to push them in to get the pipes in. it took hours to finish! had i known i wouldn’t have bought this, now imagine having to take it apart! no way i’m gonna end of cutting it apart and tossing it in the trash, total waste to the environment. so bad someone would design it like this.
customer_reviews.author: Paulyd

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson and while he seemed excited at first, he did not like that the bars were slanted and hard to get a foothold to climb. I would opt for a climbing toy with bars that are straight and easy for a child to climb. We ended up using this as a play tent draping a large sheet over it. Also, the colors faded badly if left in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Squiggy

customer_reviews.title: I Would NEVER, EVER, EVER! BuY This Awful Thing Again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most godawful unfriendly thing I’ve EVER tried to assemble. It should come with a warning “May Induce Screaming Fits and Insanity!” Seriously people, how could something soooo hard to put together make it to market? There’s absolutely nothing to prevent someone from making one tiny mistake and then having to take the entire thing apart, screaming all the way, thumbs bloody from the awful metal connector buttons. The included “tool” to help depress the connector buttons is an utter joke of plastic garbage. Thanks to this piece of junk, now me, my wife, AND out toddler are having a rotten afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Pissante

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, But Very Difficult To Assemble
customer_reviews.text: The tool that comes with this is a joke. It's practically useless. Some pieces lock in with difficulty. Although we are used to physical work, this set is ridiculous. Read all instructions carefully BEFORE starting. It's complex and difficult to get pieces in the correct position. We ended up using a flat screwdriver to push in some very stiff buttons. Also, construct this in the space you plan to keep it, as the size makes it difficult to move in and out of doors. Taking it apart to move it is not recommended. We will most likely use a hacksaw when moving ours.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Doss

customer_reviews.title: Must be an engineer to put together
customer_reviews.text: They say eezy peezy assembly but we all 3 are quite educated and can read and this was a pain in the butt to assemble Took 4 hours and the locking mechanisms kept breaking and popping out Some did not work It is dreadful to put together However the finished product is very adorable and our daughter loved it for her bday
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for CV19 everyone at home : )
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting assembly to be worse after reading reviews, relax y’all, it’s not that bad. 40 minutes at night: counting parts and organizing. Completed first few steps. 40 - 50 minutes next day, outside, finished up! Go slow and use a tool to help. Another reviewer suggested at flat head screwdriver to push the buttons or tab down, worked like a charm! Only got pinched once the whole time. Now it’s been kid tested and everyone is thrilled. Awesome to have for the yard. Safe and sturdy and not that bad to set up.
customer_reviews.author: CV_B

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy, a couple of design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars, but it came with the wrong size screws for the joiners covers making it near to impossible to put the top. Luckily I found 4 perfect smaller screws in my husband's caddy, that fit fine. Also some of the interlocks bottoms did not pup up after snaping them, however -and hopefully- doesn't affect the stability but I think is a design flaw. We'll see as the time passes how it holds up. My kids love it and THANKS to other buyers for the flat head screw driver tip...otherwise I wouldn't have fingers any more 😬
customer_reviews.author: Adry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool toy just seems a tad flimsy but my 3 year old son loves it so that's all that matters. Assembly was real easy, I'm reading some comments and wondering how when each piece is labeled and the instructions and pretty clear. I also like the fact being I live next door to hell (in florida) that it's easy to move around or in and out my house with ease. I assembled in less than 15min.
customer_reviews.author: Veryeducated

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Joiner pieces fall apart during assembly
customer_reviews.text: Awful assembly. Pins are incredibly hard to push down without a tool. They also fall out of the joiners and are next to impossible to get back in. It’s half assembled in our playroom and now I can’t finish the job (or get it out of the room) without disassembling it and requesting new parts. Also comes with a tool for disassembly that says it must be thrown away after you’ve used it twice. Absurd. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ali L.

customer_reviews.title: Kids are now too good at climbing
customer_reviews.text: After getting the Jungle Gym Playset frommthis same company, we ordered this, and the kids took to it like water. They LOVE climbing, and now our only problem is that they are almost too good at climbing and too nimble. We brought this on ourselves. If you do intend to use this indoors, make sure you rig plenty of padding for inevitable falls. Same is really true of outside. The thing is holding up wonderfully and looks brand new after 5 months of heavy use. Only complaint is the disconnect took is a complete pain to use. Don’t plant to take this apart and reassemble often using that tool.
customer_reviews.author: DDA

customer_reviews.title: If you like pain and frustration, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: Regret buying this, it’s going back ASAP. Could they have made it any more difficult to put together? Two rock hard “buttons” on each tube that literally evoke the worst pain...and there are dozens of them. The springs pop out too easily and after taking 15 minutes to get one back in, decided this was a POS. Cute design and I’m sure if you enjoy pain, great end product but this is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: SDNJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at the beginning of quarantine. It was hard to put together! My fingers hurt so bad during the building process. Sometimes the black piece would pop out of place and it was hard to put it back into place. I used a screw driver to not use my fingers as much. I thought this would provide more entertainment but it’s just alright. The swing I purchased provides much more entertainment. Kids are 3 girl and 6 boy
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Fun but read instructions carefully!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun and easy climbing gym to maintain and particularly good for young kids. While it seems relatively intuitive to put together, please read the instructions carefully!! One mishap on our end caused two hours to fix and reassemble. Other reviewers have gone into great detail about the process and instructions. We do like that the climbing gym is portable and easy to keep outdoors or indoors. In terms of durability, it is lighter than I expected but I don't expect to have too many kids play on it at once.
customer_reviews.author: Asun

customer_reviews.title: Tip for connector buttons
customer_reviews.text: We built this today. My number one tip is to find something to press in those connector buttons other than your fingers! We use the side of a measuring tape case and it made the job much easier!! It’s sturdy enough that I could get on it, in addition to my 4 year old, though I was careful to not get on the same spot as him and I avoided the very top level because it’s not as sturdy. He’s thrilled to have a jungle gym. So far I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Don’t put it together in the house!
customer_reviews.text: Here’s the quickest 5 star review 1. Easy to put together but not easy Taking apart 2. Light enough to literally pick up and move but sturdy and durable enough for my 4 year old 3. Don’t put together in the house you will catch hell trying to get it outside!
customer_reviews.author: TSimmons

customer_reviews.title: The assembly was a pain
customer_reviews.text: I cannot emphasize enough how awful assembly was. You’d think that since they are just push/lock buttons that it would be easy but no. My fingers were bruised, and that’s because I even used a tool to help me push the buttons down. It was truly terrible. My kids are 1.5 and almost 4 and haven’t really used it yet. I’ll probably update my review at a later time to speak on that, but for now all I can say is the assembly was -5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: dbm

customer_reviews.title: A Pain to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Whoever said this monster is easy to assemble either has nerves of steel or is completely dillusional. This thing is HARD on your hands. The posts and connection points are joined by pushing spring loaded pegs into the holes of the adjoining piece, sounds simple, but those springs are super tight and I had to fight almost every one. I used a flat head screwdriver to push the pegs down until I could force the post over it and get it into the holes. Two hours later and I'm almost done but I gave up for the day. This is the kind of toy that makes you seriously consider never buying anything again that requires assembly.
customer_reviews.author: ADawn

customer_reviews.title: Survives abuse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my sons 3rd birthday 8 months ago. My husband assembled by himself with no issues. It has thus far survived spring, winter and most of fall outside and with heavy abuse from both mother nature and my boy. We live in Texas where the summers are brutal. The boy loves it and plays with it often. It is easy to move around the yard, which is great for mowing and moving into the shade.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Reed

customer_reviews.title: Def only for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I like it or not but almost 3 yr old now has something to climb other than the couch. It took a few hours to assemble because I had a little helper. The instructions were clear and simple. However, the pins were soooo hard to push that it left my fingers bruised. The dismantle tool was useless and I had to find another way to take 1 pole off that I put on the wrong connector. Once assembled, my little one enjoyed climbing on it. I noticed the plastic poles bent ever so slightly under his 28 lb self.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: A challenge to assemble due to spring stiffness in the little buttons you need to push in, so the connectors can slide over them. I used a small block of wood to push them in... Problem Solved. Grandkids love it. EASY to pick up and move when mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Clarke Warren

customer_reviews.title: This will be enjoyed for years to come
customer_reviews.text: When children start to climb, this is a great item to have. We have set it up indoors over a cushion floor mat. I climbed up and through the center and my child instantly followed. At this point (22 months old) I provide a spot at higher levels but hand grip, feet position, and balance have already improved in one week. This climber is very strong. I'm 180 pounds and carefully step near the joints but it holds me even though it does flex, a lot. Just don't bounce on it.
customer_reviews.author: ZODC

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas present for my 3 year old!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to have! My only complaint, which I’m happy was the issue, is that it is hard to snap together, however we did not use the special tool included so I don’t know if that would’ve helped us or not. Very sturdy, breaks down for easy storage, my very active 3.5 year old has really enjoyed playing on it in our basement during this very snowy time. It’s going to be great in the summer when we move it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Ok product... but expensive for the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: light and easy to move around, good size for 2/3 year olds, fun once assembled Cons: simple but physically hard to assemble. The buttons don’t all push in easily so your fingers will hurt. The bars are all plastic so they bend from the kid’s weight- I don’t expect them to break, but no more than 2 young kids should climb at a time...
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 yrs old to climb on. It is pretty easy to hoist up on my hip and carry to another spot, it is just awkward to hold, clearly. It is sturdy for him. I even got on it separately and it held me, 120lbs. It took about 45 to an hour to assemble. One thing I will say is that, it would have been nice to have all the same tubes bundled in one bag separate from the others... but it didnt take long to sort through them either. Also, have a pair if scissors or something flat and sturdy to pop the metal buttons in, it will save some time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this climber!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my super active three year old and he loves it! It took two people to put together, but we had read previous reviews and learned some good tricks! Use a flathead screwdriver to push in the connectors - it will save your thumbs! Separate the pieces before starting - it makes assembly go a lot faster. It is super easy to move and is very sturdy because of the base's larger footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: not super easy- but awesome
customer_reviews.text: read directions for sure, it took my husband and I about 45 minutes to set up- not too bad. it was pretty easy; except some of the buttons were too hard to push down. I have arthritis- so that wasn't helping, haha. I would for sure recommend this and purchase again for a gift. its great, my 21 Month old loves it. we put a ball pit in the middle, he climbs to the top and jumps into it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Nice, difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it, we've had two or three on at a time and is sturdy. It wasn't the easiest to assemble, directions were fine but just physically difficult. And do it right, it's even harder to take a piece off, even with the provided tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: We Love It!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this for my sons 3rd birthday. He absolutely adores it. He didn’t even let me take his helmet off from another new toy before climbing to the very top (as you can see in the picture). My husband said it was very easy to assemble. It’s very sturdy and safe, which is what I love about it. My son loves climbing it every chance he gets. So glad we spent the money and chose this item among all the other choices!
customer_reviews.author: Jen MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: Pick a permanent spot!
customer_reviews.text: The kiddos loved this toy. I set it up in my living room over our long, cold winter with the intention of moving it to the outside come spring. The company provides a tool to take it apart but it's completely useless. Not happening with that thing. I finally used a screwdriver, which made the metal inside pieces offset. Attempting to fix that and work that into place is also impossible as they spring out. The company shouldn't even send that tool out and just say that you can never ever break it down. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shana Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it. I was afraid this was going to be cheaply made but that was not the case. It is quite sturdy and it’s about adult size in height. It may need to be staked into the ground if too many kids decide to play on one side. When putting it together, you have to snap the pieces together which sounds easy but was really hard which is why I gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Renee A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  My grandson Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Almost done assembly and 1 part seems to be defective. I need a new J4A or a clip to go in tube A. The clip I have fell off when I opened the box. I put it back on but when I went to clip the tube the clip fell off again. UPDATE: Shanged 3 stars to 5. Contacted the Manufacturer and they are shipping a replacement part to me. Great Customer service. The 1-800 number is included with the Assembly Instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a defective product, but this jingle gym is definitely not sturdy as advertised. The beams bow when my kids climb on it and they are only 30lbs and 40lbs. I called customer service after putting this all together and was told they could do nothing for me since we had already assembled it. I wish I knew it was this flimsy before spending so much money on it.
customer_reviews.author: JillianN

customer_reviews.title: Great climber for my grandchildren!
customer_reviews.text: It only took about two hours to put together. If you are careful to read and follow the instructions there aren't any issues that I found putting it together. The only issue was the little black spring pieces inside the tubes can pop out if you push the wrong way on them. It happened twice to me but I was able to put them back in place. At one point I misunderstood the directions and had to backtrack a step, but was able to recover easily. The kids love the climber.
customer_reviews.author: K. E.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and pretty decent sized.. Get it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter hasn't gotten off this thing... During a pandemic, and being nervous to let my 2 and a half year old run some with other kids at a park.. I figured I'd buy this to start and make our own.. This is awesome. I added a slide on the side and it's at least 3 hours of fun.. No screens, actually physical, super tired for naps and night time. Must have, seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It isn't super easy to put together, but it's not difficult. I did it by myself, while managing my 3 year old, in about 2 hours. The tool used for taking it apart was useless, but I was able to get it apart after I realized the room I originally set it up in was too small. My 1 and 3 year old boys love to play on this. Seems durable and sturdy. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tee Cee

customer_reviews.title: Great product but PAIN to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and my kids love it, but it was a GIANT PAIN to put together. It’s really hard to push the metal pin connectors into the holes and if you mess up and need to remove something, good luck! They provide a plastic tool to make it easier to push down the pins but I didn’t find it very helpful. The giant metal one was easier to assemble, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: CT-mom

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, definitely got my money's worth
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at another house when I took my 3 yr old daughter to a birthday party. Got it for my 2 girls (now 4 and 6) and they play on this every day. It's a bigger hit with the younger one, who is also into gymnastics, so she loves to hang upside down and flip off in the middle. My older one tries but she's a little too tall to do that, so she just climbs. Sometimes they ask me to cover it with blankets to make a fort and other times they tie each end of my robe belt to it and use it as a swing. Lots of fun to be had with this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Pieces could be marked a little better hard to read
customer_reviews.text: One of the hardest items to piece together ever! Snap on’s are super hard to press in and even harder to take apart! You need special tools to make this process easier! Once you’ve mastered the pieces which snap in and pop out of the holes it will be easier I use a small screwdriver and a round pointed flat dowel to push in the support brackets! It’s a process and time consuming! Good luck with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wilson

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS SOOOOO HARD TO ASSEMBLE
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for a few days. I'm still trying to assemble it. You need iron fingers. I broke one of the springs trying to assemble it, and the company sent me a video on how to fix it. The guy on the video even says "It took me 14 tries to fix it." He said you need "a bic pen, a screwdriver, and anger" to fix it. I agree. Lots of anger.
customer_reviews.author: KatieL

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my monkey
customer_reviews.text: This arrived quickly and was easy to set up. I'm 33 weeks pregnant and had no problems getting it together in under an hour, even with my 22 month old "helping". This is the perfect size for her and it seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Mullarkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Climbing Toy at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great climbing toy! We’d ordered a climber elsewhere for my granddaughter, over a month ago. Finally, I grew tired of waiting l, canceled, and started searching again. I’m so grateful i found this one. The price was almost half of the other one. It arrived in 2 days, and took my son in law 45 minutes to put together. It’s sturdy, but light enough to relocate, doesn’t get hot in the sun, and is just the right size for the toddler- early elementary age. When she saw it, she exclaimed, “a climb!” She’s barely been off it since. I predict a lot of sound sleeping after all this exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Great for price and size!
customer_reviews.text: We chose this product because of its high reviews, and because it's the only climber small enough to fit in our bowling alley of a yard AND able to accommodate bigger kids. (Ours are 8,7, and 3.) My partner and I assembled the whole thing in maybe an hour and then staked it down (stakes not included). They've been absolutely loving it so far!
customer_reviews.author: SaganHaus

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought for our grandchildren, especially the little one who has climbed everything ever since she could get around! They love it. It was in many pieces, but well-organized and my husband and son put it together in less than an hour. It's light enough to move around, yet sturdy enough for little climbers. A very good toy!
customer_reviews.author: LIrwin

customer_reviews.title: Whenever we have guests for play dates people ask where we got it since it is such a fun gross motor toy to play with indoors
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been worth every penny! We have it set up in the basement on carpet and the kids (ages 7, 5, 2.5) have been using it a lot since we put it up 3 months ago. It was not difficult to set up but my fingers were sore the next day. Whenever we have guests for play dates people ask where we got it since it is such a fun gross motor toy to play with indoors. I love it because the kids can play imaginative games with it - we also tie sheets up to make hammocks inside or cover it with blankets to make an igloo. Super fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Mendham

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with this. We were already a limited screen time family and now he’s not even interested in a screen. He just wants to play on his spiderweb all day. We put our ball pit underneath and a pile of blankets. Ours is indoors not outside but we get more use out of it inside since he has a tiny baby sister and we have cold rainy Midwest weather. I’ve know three other families that bought one after playing on ours.
customer_reviews.author: Kim_Alex

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: So far my kids love this. They are 2 and 3. We have set it up indoors and it is working fine so far. Be careful putting it together. I pinched my finger pretty bad. Also if you turn the tube the wrong way and it locks- then it is super hard to get it back to where it should be. Overall the setup did not take long. The top part does not seem as sturdy as the rest of the jungle gym. It included a dismantling tool. I’m interested to see how that works if we decide to move it outside at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less rock solid than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t the rock solid structure I imagined but it’s goid for a couple little kids. I’m a small adult and feel like I’d break this so I keep off! The top part has a tiny bit of movement to it which I didn’t expect. But at the end of the day it’s fine and I don’t regret it one bit and it’s a good indoor physical activity for kids
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Scott

customer_reviews.title: Still playing
customer_reviews.text: Update: November 2018: The grandkids use this almost daily. After 3 years of use, the grandkids want a bigger one. It has been one of their favorite toys! 2017: My grandchildren have had this for a year and a half and still play on it. The youngest is 3 and the oldest is 5. They have older cousins that play on it too. They used it in the house in the winter and outside in the summer. They had to remove the top cube to get it through the doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great once assembled, just a pain to assemble in the first place.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a pain, literally. I recommend using a stubby flathead screwdriver's blade to push down the little nubbins so as to avoid tearing up one's finger pads. The springs underlying those nubbins also had an annoying tendency to slip, such that only one of two nubbins was protruding through its proper hole. One other assembly note is that the 5-arm hub pieces have separate left- and right-oriented versions, and keeping track of this is important. All of the other hub pieces are symmetric. Once assembled after an hour or so my 3 year old loves climbing on it. The star deduction was just because assembly was more of a pain than I thought was warranted.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clark

customer_reviews.title: So fun! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and put up this weekend. This is so FUN and so COOL! Our son already loves it and the neighborhood kids think it's a lot of fun. It did take my husband and I a little over an hour to assemble. There are a lot of pieces that come with it, as expected. We took our time and it turned out great. No issues. It does not come with ground stakes, so you'll want to purchase those separately, which isn't hard to do. It looks like this will last a long time, which is just what we wanted. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: AYura

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. It wasn’t too bad to assemble, and I would encourage the use of tools since it helps. To us, the instructions were clear, it has a lot of parts, but if you follow the instructions, it’s not hard at all. Are only concern is our kid’s falling off of it, but so far, there having a good time climbing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Minshall

customer_reviews.title: Issues with assembly
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this thing but the build was terrible, either they have an out of spec mould or the spring detent buttons are out of spec... some of them very easy to click together other ones I’m having to force down the detent with a screwdriver using a lot of force .... causing the spring to pop out and having to reinstall it ... for the price considering this is all plastic ... this really should be simple to put together
customer_reviews.author: coffee nut

customer_reviews.title: Missing a major part
customer_reviews.text: A pain to put together and in the end was missing a major part.
customer_reviews.author: SwissymissTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Due to lockdowns we don’t take our daughter to the park or school anymore. This climbing gym fits nicely in our small backyard and provides lots of exercise and fun for her. My husband put it together in less than 30 minutes. It’s very strong yet easy for us to move when we need to mow the lawn. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure you have ALL of your Pieces before assembling!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a great product if it hadn't of come with a piece not included in the manual, and additionally missing a piece. I was only offered a return refund (minus shipping cost) or a 20% refund for convince. Make sure you have EVERY piece before assembling because it will be a pain to take apart. Was a downer to find this out the day before my daughters birthday..
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Our 2yo and 4yo love this. It's easy to move around the yard. Not too hard to put together, but definitely read the instructions first (I put many of the snaps on backwards and had to redo, which was a pain for my fingers). Have had it for a few months and it's holding up great. The kids have even asked Mom & Dad to play on it. It can hold us! Definitely a good investment for us
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use at Your Own Risk
customer_reviews.text: If this company had children’s best interest, they would have included the support stakes for the climber. Every hardware store does not carry the support stakes. And the top of the climber is not sturdy dor a mere 40lb. (4 yr old) child.
customer_reviews.author: L. English

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to Love this, however... Kids just aren't into it. The problem is the design. In order to step up, they need to be able to reach the clusters in the center of the "stars". It's just to high for little ones. I feel like if they were big enough to do with ease, they would be to big for this.
customer_reviews.author: indigo

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my nephew's Christmas present and it is so cool all the kids have so much fun on this thing hanging upside down and learning how to climb at first we threw a bunch of pillows in the middle so when they felt it it hurt themselves to get used to it really good quality and loads of fun
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Literal pain to set up, but the kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared for bruised fingers and hands. There is nothing easy about this setup. Sure, the instructions are simple and the idea is easy, but those buttons are very rigid. If you have steel gloves, or even better, fingertips made out of steel, this is for you. We had to end up using a screwdriver for the harder ones. Otherwise, the kids really love this and it's fun.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee

customer_reviews.title: Great little climber
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our grandson when he was 2. It is a little hard for him to climb at first but now that he is almost 3 he can navigate it well. He will grow into it well. It is sturdy and we can easily move it around the yard. It was fairly easy to put together, but watch the directions carefully because if you make a mistake it is very hard to get pieces apart to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Hard assembly!
customer_reviews.text: This was a worthwhile purchase overall, but I downgraded a bit because it was ridiculously difficult to assemble and not quite as heavy or sturdy as I expected it to be. But other than that my daughter (2.5 yo) does seem to enjoy it, although it’s not getting as much use as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Annamal24

customer_reviews.title: Set up was painful ..
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have mentioned, this is not “easy peezee” to put together. The part that makes it difficult, is the small buttons that snap the pieces into place. Get ready to lose all feeling in your fingers and definitely don’t mess up putting it together because unsnapping the pieces is killer... you might as well cut your finger off. BUT... with that being said, I put together by myself (without my husbands help), in about an hour and a half (with both of my toddlers monitoring). The end result, they love it, it’s sturdy and a great addition to outside play toys.
customer_reviews.author: Casie

customer_reviews.title: Good for Maneuverability
customer_reviews.text: We got this hoping to have something that was easy to move for mowing the lawn and this is perfect for that! It is not the sturdiest climber, but certainly sturdy enough for climbing and fort fun! Our kids hang and climb all day and we haven't heard any complaints or been concerned for their safety at all. And it is light enough to move without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great for active kids!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 & 2 year old boys love this. It was easy to assemble and easy to move to cut the grass. Only thing that would make it better is if the bars were textured. They tend to be slippery when wet causing the kids to lose their footing.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: The top portion is SUPER flimsy and scary so I removed it
customer_reviews.text: The top portion is SUPER flimsy and scary so I removed it. Some of the black metal pieces inside the tubes to snap them together were not bent correctly so they slid out and were loose. I was able to use 2 from the stack that I removed to replace the bars with loosened pieces. Over all its pretty cool for little kids. I have 3 little ones who play on it and the oldest out of them is 7 and she is probably maxing it out with the 5 and 3 year old on it together.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I bought this ignoring the bad reviews because there are always those negative Nancy’s. Well they are right and this indeed sucks! We have 4 of the black pins not pushing out into the tubes. As you can see the “b” tube and “b” leg on the j5 are in the correct spots. Waste of money an time
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Wait, coffee is supposed to be hot?!?
customer_reviews.text: I actually finished a cup of coffee in one sitting! It was glorious. My 2 and 3 year old played (very little fighting) for over an hour before (no joke) asking to go inside to rest. I have never seen them sit in one spot before let alone for several minutes at a time. 100% worth every penny. My husband put it together by himself in about 30 minutes. Only complaint was that his fingers were a little sore from pinching the pieces together. He did use a small handheld drill to tighten the screws. Very sturdy and much enjoyed by the kids and by this mom!
customer_reviews.author: Gibby

customer_reviews.title: Not a whole bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to push the snaps down to slide the polls in. Once all assembled my husband and I were very shocked how unstable this is. The top of it is very loose. Were not comfortable with out 22 lbs 2 year ild even clmibing on this. So disappointed in the product for how much it was.
customer_reviews.author: Alesha Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews complaining about the assembly and how terrible it is. Honestly, as long as you read the directions first and follow them this thing is easy. Took me about 1.5 hours with a dinner break. Make sure you use the included tool and take your time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life saver. I had a get together with other families and all the children played on this from the time they walked in until the time they left. My daughter gets her climbing out and she’s become really good at getting on and off. At first I was super scared about her falling but she’s learned so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: EricaBlair

customer_reviews.title: This thing is my mortal enemy.
customer_reviews.text: Reading directions is hard, we've all accidentally put the wrong piece in the wrong spot. However, this thing doesn't have screws. It has metal seasaw crap that hurts your hands so much that you have to use the manual as a makeshift thimble just to put the pieces ON it. That's every piece you put on, by the way. Now, let's say you put something in the wrong spot... Grab yourself a stick, push the black bit in, and fight with the metal thingamabob until black magic happens and the tube finally pops off. This thing is my mortal enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome to have, 100% worth the money. This is lightweight enough that you can move it whenever but the kids aren’t going to tip it over when playing at all. Our kids Ages range from 1-7 and they all love it, whether it’s just playing underneath or climbing to the top and hollering to their friends!
customer_reviews.author: MHem

customer_reviews.title: Monkey bars and a play tent!!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 and 4 year old love these monkey bars ... we had to put it in the basement due to size versus their playroom, but we love this product. They also love that it can be used as a tent by putting a blanket over it and throwing some cozy pillows inside 🤗 The cons of this product, fingers hurt after assembling it and it’s not easily disassembled (I would love to use it both inside and outside but we would have to take it apart and it would be too time consuming)
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom

customer_reviews.title: There's An Assembly Tool
customer_reviews.text: Following the directions, we assembled the spring-tension pieces with fingers that became tired. When we completed the assembly, there was one piece left over. It was not mentioned in the instructions. It was the assembly tool that would have made working with the spring tension pieces so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Explorefun4

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble-fun to play on
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews about how hard it was to assemble, I took time to separate and lay out all parts in advance and followed instructions. Assembled by myself in a little over an hour. I used one of the parts as a 'thimble' to help push in the locking buttons. My toddler is not quite able to climb on it yet- but he still loves playing 'in and on' it and hanging from the bars he can reach--I think it'll be a great coordination builder
customer_reviews.author: AmyCQ

customer_reviews.title: My Monkeys Like It
customer_reviews.text: Kids 2 and 3 yrs like it, don't use it as much as I thought they would, both are voracious climbers, only had it since Christmas. Took my friend, who is VERY adept at putting things together about an hour, also received a few VERY PAINFUL hand pinches,,,so beware
customer_reviews.author: margaret rivero

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome play structure. Some parts were Easy to assemble but some where challenging. It took about 1.5 hours to put together by myself. It would have been faster if some people the pieces didn’t give me trouble. It was still worth it. My son loves his “Spider Man’s Web”
customer_reviews.author: A R S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent climber.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for backyard use for 6, 4, 3, & 1 yr old. It was a simple build for my husband and was complete in about an hour. Though the top box wobbles a bit, it appears very sturdy under the weight of all 4 kids at the same time. It is lightweight and easy to move which is wonderful for maintaining grass. We will not be securing it with anchors as recommended. I seriously doubt it would tip. We put all the kids on one side initially just to check, and it didn't budge. Very much recommend this product for young children.
customer_reviews.author: Leah CE

customer_reviews.title: I was debating this or the larger one and I’m so happy I ordered this one
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves it. I was debating this or the larger one and I’m so happy I ordered this one! It’s smaller but perfect for him he is able to climb and hang off of it like a pro! It’s light weight and can easily be moved from one area to another. Beware the assembly is easy but watch your fingers I have a few blood blisters. Overall I am happy with the purchase definitely more so for toddlers would not recommend for older children as the plastic although sturdy I fear it may break with older children.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Long-Term Fun & Large Motor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kid during the CoronaVirus epidemic... seeing as how schools are closed and work is closed, we will be stuck at home a lot and needed some long-term entertainment and large motor activities. The perfect gift, the perfect item, THANK YOU. It’s so easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Eezy Peezy Monkey Bars Climbing Tower - Active Outdoor Fun for Kids Ages 3 to 8 Years Old, Green/Blue
product_meta.description: Eezy Peezy Monkey Bars Climbing Tower will provide endless play for toddlers! The Monkey Bars are made of quality plastic enhanced with UV protection. Though durable, this set is surprisingly lightweight and easy to assemble with positive-engagement interlocking post and joints. This set is lightweight and convenient to move your child will be able to enjoy having their favorite activity indoors or outdoors rain or shine! For ages 3 to 8. Max load 150 lbs. Dimensions (assembled) 70. 07x65. 53x46. 65 (inches) Product weight: 27lbs.
feature_bullets: Endless play: children will enjoy endless fun and active playtime with the toy Monster monkey bars climbing tower. This will quickly become a favorite backyard activity.
Durable: featuring interlocking plastic tubes and connectors with double self locking springs make this set Durable, yet surprisingly lightweight and easy to assemble.
Quality: Made of high quality plastic enhanced with UV protection. Uv protection offers long lasting outdoor play while quality plastic material ensures long lasting lifetime of product.
Portable: ideal size for indoor and outdoor use. Lightweight and easy assembly makes it convenient for unit to be moved easily so your child always has their favorite toy rain or shine.

Includes: Monster monkey bars climbing tower. Assembled Dimensions 70. 07 x 65. 53 x 46. 65 (inches). Product weight 27lbs. Max load: 150lbs. Assembly required. Ages 3 to 8. Note: anchors not included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,385 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
